Champion.gg hasn't released 6.20 stats yet, as it takes them 3 days from patch day to do so. OP is complaining about the new auto attack lock in regards to riven, which does make her fast combo a bit easier since it is easier to not accidentally cancel your autos or some crap like that.

I don't consider this as a bug and i don't know why every other person does. Those who know how to do a fast combo without this, won't notice any change. And this is how Riot intended it, to be harder to cancel autos. 
As far as i see Riot has 2 choices>

1) Remove this from Riven, but that would mean its unfair since every other champion would get a slight buff because of it, while she wouldn't. Unfair that everyone else can have this feature while she can't.  
2) Not implement this at all. Big problem again since this is something they wanted to change for a while.
3) Remove her fast Q animation canceling in order for this to work. Again, that would destroy a champion. 

Either way as you see, there is no really a way out.

The issue is that she can cancel both auto animations AND skills I think, and as you pointed out keeps her balance in a precarious state.  It would likely be easier for them to remove it and then be able to balance her like every other champion, getting predictable changes from increases to her health regeneration, defenses, or damage.  Currently the smallest of changes can sometimes create unusually dramatic changes in her performance, as evidenced by the recent change in how auto attacks are registered.

In short, Riven needs to have animation cancelling on skills removed then it wouldn't matter about auto attack animation cancelling as much.

> [{quoted}](name=Ictus,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=xf7hWgHc,comment-id=00080000000000000001,timestamp=2016-10-07T18:13:54.643+0000)

Indeed she has and has always been harder to balance because of an interaction that few other champions can do, and none as frequently.  Thus my point, as long as she remains able to cancel animations for skills she will remain difficult to balance.  She would greatly benefit from allowing her to queue up the skills but finish the animations for one skill before starting another, and then rebalance her survivability and damage around that, maybe giving her a cooldown refund if she is interrupted in a combo for whatever skill was next up.  Then she would behave like other champions who get locked into their animations and cannot just move to cancel the animation and still get the damage.

every single champion in the game can cancel animations for skills... there are 2 parts to every animation in the game.  the front end, which happens before the skill fires and damage is done, and the back end, which happens after the skill fires and damage is done.  you can always cancel the back end animation, and this is intentional.  rivens q just happens to be mostly back end animation, whereas a skill like lux ult is almost entirely front end.  most skills are in the middle of the 2.
